title: English (1777) The Holy Family Bible (Study)
description:
The "Holy Family Bible," published in 1777 by Reverend Alexander Fortescu, D.D., Rector of Structor, is a comprehensive study Bible that includes the scriptures of the Old and New Testaments, as well as the Apocrypha. It features concise explanatory notes on all the difficult texts of Scripture, specifically addressing the objections of infidels and explaining obscure passages for easy understanding. The Bible is illustrated with copper plates, adding a visual dimension to the study. Printed and sold by J. Wilkes in Winchester by appointment of the proprietor, this Bible is in two volumes, providing a complete Bible experience. Reverend Fortescu, known for his works such as the "Devout Christian's Family Instructor" and "Preparatory Devotions for the First Receiving the Lord's Supper," aims to make the Bible accessible and comprehensible to a wide audience, enhancing religious education and countering skepticism. This edition is a valuable resource for deepening understanding and devotion among its readers.

Language: English
Notes & contents: 2 volumes in 1 (COMPLETE BIBLE)
